The relative amounts of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> present in the nucleus of a cell at four different stages of the life cycle are shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Relative amounts of <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></math> present in the nucleus of a cell

Based on Figure 1, which of the following statements correctly links a stage of the cell cycle with the event occurring at that stage?

choices.label: Stage <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the <math alttext="G 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> phase of the cell cycle.

Synthesis of sufficient <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for two daughter cells occurs in stage <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The replication of genetic material occurs in stage <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IV</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Synthesis of sufficient <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for two daughter cells occurs in stage <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
